children.subject: yea exactly so I'm just wondering how big of a deal that will be and if I should consider not taking both at the same time for that reason
The final will be back-to-back from 7 to 1 at night...
oh wow that sucks. do you know where I could find the alternate final info?
There's no choice, 61C has the very last final slot and since the alternate exam has to be after the actual exam (to prevent leaking of test questions), this is the only possibility.
I think next semester's 61C and 170 are at the same time?

Hey, I am a sophomore and took 61C and 170 this - or I guess more like last - semester concurrently. A few friends of mine took it together as well and we generally all found it doable. That said, 61C and 170 are different beasts in their own rights and taking them together definitely stretched us a few times (for brevity I will assume you know the difference btwn 61C and 170, if not feel free to ask).

Regarding the time conflict, both lectures are fully webcasted. Last year 61C was at 8am, so a vast majority of people skipped live lecture (only 30-40 people showed up to the lectures). In general, 61C covers a lot of topics/trivia and hence is not that deep, so watching webcasts is not a loss unless you have a lot of questions. 170 lectures had better attendance but having watched them live and webcasted I did not find that much of a difference.

Last semester 61C and 170 midterms were on Tuesday/Thursday of the same week and were definitely manageable. We did not have back to back finals though, so I cannot speak to that part.

If you had to delay a course, I would delay 61C (as I am biased towards theory). However, if you like hardware/low level stuff though, then do 61C first.

TLDR: 61C + 170 is definitely doable although it will be tough at times, and webcasts are life savers.

history.content: Hey! So currently I am planning to take CS 61c and 170 concurrently, but I am wondering if it is really doable, let alone possible. aka, how big will time conflict issues factor into assignment, midterms, finals, etc. Additionally I am a sophomore so if I was to delay a course, I wanted to know if anyone had any input about which class I should take next semester. Thanks for any help in advance!!
history.subject: Taking CS 61c and 170 concurrently
